concept.title: Run Analytics reports on customer attribute data
concept.shortdesc: Create metrics and run Analytics reports on uploaded customer attribute data.

conbody.p: After you upload customer attributes and validate the schema, the system creates metrics based on the friendly names (like age or gender) that you map to the attribute strings and integers. These metrics appear in Visitor Profile > Customer Attributes reports.
If you specify a string as age, the system creates the following metrics and dimensions:

ul.li: Age dimension: Lets you run a report based on the Age attribute.
Age metric: A metric you can add to a report, such as a Unique Visitors report.
Count of Age metric: Lets you understand, for example, if visitors specified an age value on a form.

conbody.p: Because metrics are sums in a report table, you should create a calculated metric that tells you the average age. The formula for this metric is Age / Count of Age, as shown below:

Metric: Age. You have to make a calculated metric, because metrics are sums. Age divided by Count of Age. Age is created as a dimension and a metric (for data types Interger and Number in the validate schema). You'll only ever see an average age. Using Age as a dimension displays Age as the basis of the report (Customer Attributes > Age.) "Count of Age" for example would tell you if visitors specified an age value on a form.
